titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Office of the Comptroller records, 1874-2002 RG0064
titlestmt.author: University Archives, Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University

publicationstmt.publisher: Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-01-11 11:52:13 -0500.

repository.corpname: Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: George Washington University. Office of the Comptroller

did.abstract: Collection includes quarterly appraisals of the university's securities, trust fund ledgers and journals, grants and contracts,schedules of financial statements and annual financial reports.

prefercite.head: Preferred citation
prefercite.p: Office of the Comptroller records, University Archives, Special Collections Research Center, The George Washington University.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Series 2, 4, and 5 are closed to research for 50 years from date of record creation.

Access to student records is governed by the federal Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act (FERPA), which protects the privacy of student education records. Student records in Series 6 are closed for 100 years from date of record creation.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Materials acquired through transfers from the Office of the Comptroller.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Some material may be copyrighted or restricted. It is the patron's obligation to determine and satisfy copyright or other case restrictions when publishing or otherwise distributing materials found in the collections.

bioghist.head: Historical or Biographical Note
bioghist.p: The Comptroller's Office is responsible for management of the University's administrative financial operations which include the accounting, payroll, student accounts, grants and contracts, and administrative financial systems.

scopecontent.head: Collection Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Materials in the collection include quarterly appraisals of the university's securities, trust fund ledgers and journals, policies and procedures, general ledger funds, grants and contracts, application, loan, registrar forms, commencement materials, schedules of financial statements and annual financial reports (including departmental funds, building funds by name, square and lot number, endowment funds and sponsored research). The collection covers the years 1874 to 2002. Note: Not all series are processed. Ask staff for assistance.

arrangement.head: Collection Organization
arrangement.p: Organized into eight series: Financial statements and annual financial reports; Trust fund ledgers and journals; Handbooks and records; Policies and procedures, general ledger funds; Grants and contracts; Application, loan, registrar forms, commencement materials; Quarterly appraisal of the university's securities; and University budget.

did.unittitle: Financial statements and annual financial reports

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This series includes schedules of financial statements and annual financial reports (including departmental funds; building funds by name, square and lot number; endowment funds, and sponsored research). They date from 1874-2002.

Recommendations for Improvement in Internal Accounting Controls and Procedures
did.abstract: These reports were prepared for and submitted to the GW University Office of the Comptroller by Price Waterhouse and Co. Includes two seperate reports submitted in April and October, 1973, respectively. Originally filed under Acc. #855. Documents have been rehoused from there original binder.

Various files related to audits performed by Price Waterhouse and Co. on behalf of The George Washington Unviersity during the fiscal year of 1973. Includes various proposals and recommendations regarding the university's handlings of various government aid programs. Files rehoused from a binder originally titled "Management Letters" and cataloged under Acc. #855, #16.

Contains letter to Comptroller Frederick J. Narramore regarding financial statements for the 1973-74 fiscal year. Letter was rehoused from a binder originally titled "Management Letters." Originally catalogued under Acc. #855, #16.

Series of letters regarding audits and reports created by Price Waterhouse and Co. prepared for The George Washington University. Most particularly address recommendations made for George Washington University's Medical Center. Files were rehoused from a binder originally titled "Management Letters" and cataloged under Acc.#855, #16.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This series contains trust fund ledgers and journals from ca. 1920-86. Ledgers and journals prior to 1950 are not restricted.

did.abstract: Trust Fund Vouchers and Cashed Checks from GWU Trust Fund Accounts over 10 months of time. Vouchers are yellow and in individual bundles by month. Cashed checks are green and bundled in order by month. All checks and vouchers are in a reddish-brown records box.

Trust Fund Vouchers and Cashed Checks from GWU Trust Fund Accounts over 10 months of time. Vouchers are yellow and in individual bundles by month. Cashed checks are green and bundled in order by month. All checks and vouchers are in a reddish-brown records box.

Ledger of the University's expenses including categories on: capital, administration, general funds, other funds, refund, junior college, botany, english, graduate programs, expendatures, research, law, education, government, summer programs, physical education, library, maintainance, services and rentals, hospital, opthalmology, duplicates and storage, athletics, and student accounts.
Originally accessioned in June, 2000 and categorized under Acc. 855 #37.
did.physdesc: Fair condition, handle with care. Velvet cover with cracking red leather binding. Bolt bound. Measures 14" x 12" x 4.5".

did.abstract:
Contains information about closed accounts across various departments of the University. Ledger is based on accounts which were closed between 1948-1968.
Originally accessioned in June, 2000 and filed under Acc. #855.
did.physdesc: Large bolt-bound ledger book. Fabric covers with red leather corners. Good condition, however item gives off redrot residue from corners. Ledger is heavy, handle with care.

did.abstract:
Ledger including sections on cash, accounts receivable, prepaid expense - hospital, student loans (cash/investments, loans receivable), 1963 bonds cash investments, real estate control, equipment, miscellaneous, deferred income and deposits, restricted funds, surplus net investment, student loan funds, 1963 bond surplus accrued interest pay, notes and bonds - payable, tuition fees, miscellaneous fees, investment income, gifts, research grants, miscellaneous income, student activities, medical center income, student aid, residence halls, expense control, medical center expense, capital expenditures, sorority halls, auxiliary expenditures, and miscellaneous assets.
Ledger is infrequently updated between the 1950s and 1980s.

did.physdesc: Black bolt bound binder (1920s era from Stationers Loose Leaf Company). Very Good Condition. Heavy, handle with care.

did.abstract:
Ledger pages of scholarship funds from between the 1960s and 1970s. Updated to include information on gifts, awards, and interest, among other things. Organized as originally cataloged by the Office of the Comptroller.
Originally part of Acc. #855 as Item 3, "Loan Fund/Restricted Fund Ledger c. 1962- c. 1976". Rehoused from ledger binder into folders in November, 2019.

Ledger pages of general fund restricited funds from between the 1960s and 1970s. Updated to include information on gifts, awards, and interest, among other things. Organized alphabetically by name of scholarship as originally cataloged by the Office of the Comptroller.
Originally part of Acc. #855 as Item 3, "Loan Fund/Restricted Fund Ledger c. 1962- c. 1976". Rehoused from ledger binder into folders in November, 2019.

Ledger pages of general fund restricited funds from between the 1960s and 1970s. Updated to include information on gifts, awards, and interest, among other things. Organized alphabetically by name of scholarship as originally cataloged by the Office of the Comptroller.
Originally part of Acc. #855 as Item 3, "Loan Fund/Restricted Fund Ledger c. 1962- c. 1976". Rehoused from ledger binder into folders in November, 2019.

Files rehoused from a binder titled "Funded." Files in this folder all came under a tab titled "administration" and refer to funded accounts with account numbers starting with 700. Accounts refer to a variety of different scholarships, program funds, and building funds from across The George Washington University.

did.unittitle: Funded Accounts - Columbian College of Arts and Sciences
did.abstract: Files rehoused from a binder titled "Funded." Files in this folder all came under a tab titled "Columbian" and refer to funded accounts with account numbers starting with "540 701." Accounts refer to a variety of different scholarships, grants, program funds, research and academic programs, concert series, and building funds and other funds that were overseen by the Columbian College of Arts and Sciences.

Files rehoused from a binder titled "Funded." Files in this folder all came under a tab titled "Education" and refer to funded accounts with account numbers starting with "540 702-". Accounts refer to a variety of programs including internships, regionally-based fellowships, nationally-based fellowships, student teaching programs, foundations, workshops, and grants related to education at The George Washington University.

Files rehoused from a binder titled "Funded." Files in this folder all came under a tab titled "administration" and refer to funded accounts with account numbers starting with "540 703-." Accounts refer to a variety of different scholarships, program funds, internship programs, and research funds regarding engineering from across The George Washington University.

Files rehoused from a binder titled "Funded." Files in this folder all came under a tab titled "Gen. Studies" and refer to funded accounts with account numbers starting with "540 704-." Accounts refer to a variety of different scholarships, administrative program, conference funds, course funds, research programs, institutues, internships, workshops, student teaching programs, academic programs hosted by NASA, the FBI, and the Pentagon, and programs related to nursing, the military, and other programs within The George Washington University.

Files rehoused from a binder titled "Funded." Files in this folder all came under a tab titled "administration" and refer to funded accounts with account numbers starting with "540 705-". Accounts refer to a variety of purposes including centers, institutes, and programs related to federal departments hosted at The George Washington University.

Files rehoused from a binder titled "Funded." Files in this folder all came under a tab titled "Grad. Council" and refer to funded accounts with account numbers starting with "540 706-". Accounts refer to a variety of purposes including centers, fellowships, institutes, and partnership programs related to the Graduate Council at The George Washington University.

controlaccess.subject: Universities and colleges -- Graduate work -- Administration
Endowments
Fund raising

did.abstract: Files rehoused from a binder titled "Funded." Files in this folder all came under a tab titled "Law" and refers to funded accounts with account numbers starting with "540 707-". Accounts refer to a variety of internships, institutes, centers, material funds, endowments, foundations, workshops, conferences, and grants related to The George Washington University Law School. The law school was previously known as the "National University School of Law at The George Washington University" and the "National Law Center" at the time these records were being kept.

Files rehoused from a binder titled "Funded." Files in this folder all came under a tab titled "Medicine" and refers to funded accounts with account numbers starting with "540 708-". Accounts refer to a variety of purposes including funds, programs, research, workshops, courses, seminars, and chairships related to the School of Medicine at The George Washington University.

Files rehoused from a binder titled "Funded." Files in this folder all came under a tab titled "Public Affairs" and refers to funded accounts with account numbers starting with "540 709-". Accounts refer to a variety of purposes including the Institute of Sino-Soviet Studies, Ford Grant Programs, and other grants under the Public Affairs program at The George Washington University.

Files rehoused from a binder titled "Funded." Files in this folder all came under a tab titled "Summer Sessions" and refers to funded accounts with account numbers starting with "540 710-". Accounts refer to a variety of purposes including NDEA Advanced Study in English and the Summer English Institute at The George Washington University.

Files rehoused from a binder titled "Funded." Files in this folder all came under a tab titled "Airlie" and refers to funded accounts with account numbers starting with "540 713-". Accounts refer to a variety of purposes including research for the U.S. Public Health Service (USPHS), programs for handicapped and deaf students filed under "Airlie" at The George Washington University.

Files rehoused from a binder titled "Funded." Files in this folder all came under a tab titled "Peace Corps" and refers to funded accounts with account numbers starting with "540 714-". Accounts refer to the Peace Corps programs at The George Washington University.

Files rehoused from a binder titled "Funded." Files in this folder all came under a tab titled "Law" and refers to funded accounts with account numbers starting with "540". Accounts refer to a variety of purposes, including programs, organizations, clincs, residencies, grants, funds, and estates related to The George Washington University Hospital.

Files rehoused from a binder titled "Funded." Files in this folder all came under a tab titled "Law" and refers to funded accounts with account numbers starting with "540 750-". Accounts refer to various book funds kept by Lisner Library at The George Washington University. Lisner Library was the forerunner to the current libraries at GWU.

Files rehoused from a binder titled "Funded." Files in this folder all came under a tab titled "Misc." and refers to funded accounts with account numbers starting with "540". Accounts refer to a variety of purpopses including annual giving campaigns, trust funds, endowed funds, conferences, grants, federal work-study programs, and other accounts at The George Washington University.

Files rehoused from a binder titled "Funded." Files in this folder all came under a tab titled "Agency" and refers to funded accounts with account numbers starting with "540". Accounts refer to a variety of purposes including the School of Education, Women's Board Gift Shop, Law Library, and GW Faculty Alumni Club at The George Washington University.

Includes accounts receivable entries for the fiscal months of September to December, 1953. Includes updated account totals for schools, institutions, and miscellaneous purchases within the university, including tuitions, fees, housing, and college budgets. Journal was originally filed as Acc. #855 and rehoused from its original binder. Accounts are organized by month and kept in their original order as kept by the Office of the Comptroller.

Includes accounts receivable entries for the year of 1954. Includes updated account totals for schools, institutions, and miscellaneous purchases within the university, including tuitions, fees, housing, and college budgets. Journal was originally filed as Acc. #855 and rehoused from its original binder. Accounts are organized by month and kept in their original order as kept by the Office of the Comptroller.

Includes accounts receivable entries for the year of 1955. Includes updated account totals for schools, institutions, and miscellaneous purchases within the university, including tuitions, fees, housing, and college budgets. Journal was originally filed as Acc. #855 and rehoused from its original binder. Accounts are organized by month and kept in their original order as kept by the Office of the Comptroller.

Includes accounts receivable entries for the year of 1956. Includes updated account totals for schools, institutions, and miscellaneous purchases within the university, including tuitions, fees, housing, and college budgets. Journal was originally filed as Acc. #855 and rehoused from its original binder. Accounts are organized by month and kept in their original order as kept by the Office of the Comptroller.

Includes accounts receivable entries for the year of 1957. Includes updated account totals for schools, institutions, and miscellaneous purchases within the university, including tuitions, fees, housing, and college budgets. Journal was originally filed as Acc. #855 and rehoused from its original binder. Accounts are organized by month, largely in the form of quarterly account updates, and kept in their original order as kept by the Office of the Comptroller.

Includes accounts receivable entries for the year of 1958. Includes updated account totals for schools, institutions, and miscellaneous purchases within the university, including tuitions, fees, housing, and college budgets. Journal was originally filed as Acc. #855 and rehoused from its original binder. Accounts are organized by month and kept in their original order as kept by the Office of the Comptroller.

Includes accounts receivable entries for the year of 1959. Includes updated account totals for schools, institutions, and miscellaneous purchases within the university, including tuitions, fees, housing, and college budgets. Journal was originally filed as Acc. #855 and rehoused from its original binder. Accounts are organized by month and kept in their original order as kept by the Office of the Comptroller.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This series contains handbooks, revisions, and memoranda. They range in date from 1975 to 1980. The materials concern George Washington University Policies and Procedures, the Planning and Budgeting Office, wages, and campus funding.

did.unittitle: Policies and procedures, general ledger funds

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This series contains policies and procedures and general ledger funds from 1990.

did.unittitle: Policy and procedure for establishing R funds
General ledger expend, account definitions, purposes
General ledger expend, account definitions, purposes

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This series contains grants and contracts from 1971 through 1985.

did.unittitle: Application, loan, registrar forms, commencement materials

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to student records is governed by the federal Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act (FERPA), which protects the privacy of student education records. Student records are closed for 100 years from date of record creation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This series contains application, loan, registrar forms, and commencement materials from the 1930s.

did.unittitle: Quarterly appraisal of the university's securities

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This series contains quarterly appraisals of the university's securities from 1961 and 1962.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This series contains financial schedules, and range in date from 1876-2002.
